item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Saturday, November 9, 2024 at 1:10 AM UTC
item.description:
1. Delta: A syntax-highlighting pager for Git, diff, grep, and blame output (40 points | 3 comments)
2. Mitochondria Are Alive (400 points | 280 comments)
3. Can humans say the largest prime number before we find the next one? (64 points | 7 comments)
4. In Memory of Stiver (258 points | 14 comments)
5. Multiple new macOS sandbox escape vulnerabilities (445 points | 123 comments)
6. It's legal for police to use deception in interrogations. Some want that to end (57 points | 33 comments)
7. Stabilizing the Obra Dinn 1-bit dithering process (2017) (388 points | 69 comments)
8. Notes on Guyana (40 points | 31 comments)
9. Apple Macintosh before System 7 (65 points | 44 comments)
10. My Notes on Apple Math Notes (53 points | 11 comments)
11. Making Electronic Calipers (79 points | 23 comments)
12. Claude AI to process secret government data through new Palantir deal (56 points | 9 comments)
13. Funding restored for man-page maintenance (21 points | 12 comments)
14. Zep AI (YC W24) Is Hiring DevRel / Community Managers to Build Agent Memory ( | hide)
15. Python Logic Simulation Library (40 points | 2 comments)
16. Show HN: Asterogue, my sci-fi roguelike, is now playable on the web (240 points | 68 comments)
17. Algol-68 seemed like a good idea – until it wasn't (25 points | 14 comments)
18. Λ-2D: An Exploration of Drawing as Programming Language (169 points | 45 comments)

20. What Is a Staff Engineer? (57 points | 56 comments)

22. Neural Optical Flow for PIV in Fluids (5 points | 2 comments)
23. FDA proposes ending use of oral phenylephrine as OTC nasal decongestant (252 points | 460 comments)
24. A Craving for Calculation (3 points | discuss)
25. LoRA vs. Full Fine-Tuning: An Illusion of Equivalence (184 points | 45 comments)
26. What does a scientist look like? Children drawing women more than ever before (7 points | discuss)
27. Claude Shannon: Mathematician, engineer, genius and juggler (2017) (133 points | 50 comments)
28. The Cybergypsies (Indra Sinha, 1999) (37 points | 3 comments)
29. Perceptually lossless (talking head) video compression at 22kbit/s (186 points | 118 comments)
30. The evolution of nepotism in academia, 1088-1800 (69 points | 85 comments)
